intro: Bennettiodendron leprosipes var. rugosifolium, commonly known as the rough-leaved bennettiodendron, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and elliptical, leathery leaves with a rough, textured surface. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests.
